# Tender Announcement

**Elevator Modernization, Laboratory Wing, AAFC Saskatoon Research and Development Centre**

## Notice

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites qualified contractors to submit a proposal for the modernization of the traction elevator in the laboratory wing of the Saskatoon Research and Development Centre. The successful contractor will be responsible for replacing major components to enhance safety and reliability, and upgrading the elevator to meet ASME A17.1/CSA B44-2013 code.

## Description

The scope of work includes, but is not limited to:

1. Replacement of all wiring and travelers.
2. Installation of a gearless traction machine.
3. Replacement of sheaves.
4. Upgrading the landing system.
5. Replacement of the controller, operating panels, and other electrical components.
6. Installation of fixtures, buttons, interior panels, and flooring.
7. Replacement of the door operator, interlock, and pickup rollers.

Optional work may include the modernization of the hydraulic elevator in the front lobby of the same building, which will require the replacement of major components, upgrading to meet the ASME A17.1/CSA B44-2013 code, and includes similar scope of work items as above.

## Method of Selection

This is a two-phase selection process. Bidders must submit a bid in two phases:

1. Phase One: Bidders must submit a qualification and experience package, which will be evaluated to determine their eligibility to proceed to Phase Two.
2. Phase Two: Bidders will be invited to submit a pricing bid, which will be evaluated to determine the successful contractor.

## Western Canada Procurement Regions

* This tender is open to qualified contractors across Canada.

## Tender Requirements

* Bidders must submit their Phase One package electronically in PDF format by email to: [aafc.wscprocurement-csoapprovisionnement.aac@agr.gc.ca](mailto:aafc.wscprocurement-csoapprovisionnement.aac@agr.gc.ca)
* The subject line of the email must include the solicitation number.
* Bidders must ensure that their submission meets the format and content requirements outlined in the tender documents.
* Electronic submissions must not exceed 5MB in size.
* Alternative formats for electronic submissions will not be accepted.
